result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik Kenneth Lafler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Must obtain/maintain full-time employment.
If unemployed, defendant to provide work search documentation with a minimum of 10 searches to CSA and Agent by 4:30pm each Friday.

Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling/treatment as directed by agent. 
Sign all releases authorizing treatment provider to contact any and all collateral sources including CCAP information, and such other releases as requested by agent.
Treatment provider to report progress or lack thereof including lack of adequate effort or engagement to agent and, if requested by Court, to the Court. 
Treatment provider to provide at least quarterly progress reports to agent and if, requested by Court, to the Court.

Pay Child Support as directed by CSA.
Sanctions as follows:
If Defendant quits employment or is fired due to insubordination = 10 days DCJ.
If any missed appointments = 10 days DCJ.
If any missed child support payments = 10 days DCJ.
Failure to sign releases = jail until signed.

Shall submit a DNA sample. 
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

timeConds.notes:
Shall serve 1 year DCJ w/h&t commencing forthwith
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges. Huber can be used for treatment as authorized by agent.

records.addlTxt:
9:57 AM Defendant Erik Kenneth Lafler in court, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Erik Kenneth Lafler.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights compliance has been met; discussion held on restitution-no restitution requested; parties stipulate to 128 days of credit-so ordered. Court reviews agreement, rights, charges, and penalties. As to count 1, as a repeater, def enters a plea of guilty; Court makes findings, accepts plea, and enters conviction on count 1 as a repeater; counts 2, 3, and 4 are DRI; Sentencing arguments heard; def makes statement.
Court heard and imposes the following sentence on count 1:
2 years IC + 1 year ES **IMPOSED AND STAYED** consecutive to any other sentence (128 days credit upon revocation)
Probation for 3 years with the following conditions:
1 year conditional jail w/ h&t (employment OR treatment as authorized by Agent)
Obtain/maintain employment
Pay child support as directed by CSA
If unemployed, def to provide work search documentation with a minimum of 10 searches to CSA and Agent by 4:30 pm each Friday
Any treatment deemed appropriate by Agent
Sign all releases authorizing treatment provider to contact any and all collateral sources including CCAP information, and such other releases as requested by agent.
Treatment provider to report progress or lack thereof including lack of adequate effort or engagement to agent and, if requested by Court, to the Court. 
Treatment provider to provide at least quarterly progress reports to agent and if, requested by Court, to the Court. 
Court costs
DNA + costs
Def is not eligible for SAP or CIP

Sanctions as follows:
If def quits employment or is fired due to insubordination: 10 days jail
Any missed appointments: 10 days jail
Any missed child support payments: 10 days jail
Failure to sign releases: jail until signed
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Stroschein heard on motion to modify bond; State response, opposes same; Atty. Strohschein response; Court heard, reduction is not warranted and denies motion

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim business or other branches of victim business.

1:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Erik Kenneth Lafler appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (eligible) appeared by video for Erik Kenneth Lafler. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $5000 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim business or other branches of victim business.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
